column1: ==Portrayal in adaptations==

File:The Lord of the Rings (film series) - Galadriel.jpg as Galadriel in The Lord of the Rings (film series)
File:The Lord of the Rings - The Fellowship of the Ring (video game) - Galadriel.JPG

File:The Hobbit - An Unexpected Journey - Galadriel.jpg as Galadriel in The Hobbit (film series)
1978: The Lord of the Rings (1978 film):
:Galadriel is voiced by Annette Crosbie.
1981: The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series):
:The voice of Galadriel is provided by Marian Diamond. In addition to the Lothlórien episodes
column2: the voice of Galadriel is heard in Shelobs Lair as a reminder to use the phial
column3: and she appears with Elrond in the final episode in the Shire
column4: as they journey towards the Grey Havens.

column1: 2001: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring:
:Galadriel is played by Cate Blanchett. Galadriel narrates the Prologue
column2: explaining the creation of the Rings of Power and the War of the Last Alliance. Earlier plans considered were to have either Frodo or Gandalf narrate the Prologue
column3: but this was dropped: Frodo was not alive until thousands of years after these events happened
column5: he was not present in Middle-earth at the time; the Wizards came some one thousand years after the Prologue ends. Thus Galadriel narrates the Prologue
column6: because she had first-hand accounts of this history and actively participated in its events.

column1: 2002: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring (video game):
:Galadriel
column3: is the narrator of the Prologue and the Epilogue

column1: 2002: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers:
:Galadriel frequently consults telepathically with Elrond; there is an indication from the books that the two were able to communicate in some way
column2: without specific reference. In the film
column4: Galadriel and Elrond send an army of Elves - led by Haldir - to Battle of the Hornburg to aid the Rohirrim. In the DVD commentary
column5: Peter Jackson and his fellow writers explain that they worried audiences would wonder why the Elves dont seem to be helping in the war
column7: they felt that actually inserting an entire separate battle scene at Lothlórien would take up too much screentime and resources.

column1: 2003: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King:
:A spiritual apparition of Lady Galadriel appears to provide Frodo strength following his passage through Shelobs Lair
column2: soon after he uses the Phial that she gave him.  She is later seen leaving Middle-Earth along with other Ring-Bearers
column3: but in film version her husband Celeborn departs with her at the same time.

column1: 2006: The Lord of the Rings: The Battle for Middle-earth II:
:Galadriel is the strongest of "Hero" units available to the Free Peoples. If a players army manages to spot Gollum on the battlefield
column2: take The One Ring from him and deliver it to their forces
column3: the option to "summon" Galadriel unlocks for a large amount of resources. Thus
column4: Lady Galadriel is represented as succumbing to corruption of The Ring
column5: similar to the respective scene in the The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring movie.

column1: 2007: The Lord of the Rings Online:
:Galadriel is a non-playable character
column2: who narrates cutscenes and instances throughout the second Volume of the Epic story. Introduced in The Lord of the Rings Online: Mines of Moria Book VI: The Shadowy Abyss
column3: she usually resides on a talan at Caras Galadhon.

column1: 2012-14: The Hobbit (film series):
:Cate Blanchett reprised her role as Galadriel
column2: although the character itself is absent from the novel. She appears as part of the White Council alongside Saruman
column4: she telepathically urges Gandalf to further seek the true identity of the Sauron#Saurons Return. Finally
column5: during the attack on Dol Guldur
column6: Galadriel plays a larger role. She first rescues Gandalf from captivity
column7: and is ultimately the one to drive Sauron from the fortress using her Phial of Galadriel.

column1: 2014: Middle-earth: Shadow of Mordor:
:Galadriel is featured in the game
column2: although she is a non-playable character.
